item.title: Converting a Bionic install to Kali on the Lenovo C630
item.description: Since I’m a Kali developer for my day job, I like to “dogfood” and run Kali on most of my machines. Recently, since the majority of the support is in a 5.7-ish kernel, I went ahead and installed Bionic to a partition on the internal storage, and then went about “upgrading” it to run Kali instead of the Bionic install. This will be a bit of a walkthrough to show how I did it, and can be used as a general guide for converting an Ubuntu install to Kali, without reinstalling.
